column4: Anybody has got any of these "multimedia" keyboards to work with Linux?
i've got my volume and mute keys working
anything special you had to do?  Just remember that from years ago, you had to have a specific driver for your specific keyboard if it did anything other than just the normal keys.
there was a step i don't remember, but i'm not sure how important it was; anyway, the main thing was system -> preferences -> shortcuts
yip
sudo hdparm -d1 /dev/<whatever>
but I don't have to "enable" dma - like in the wiki it does in step 4 for when you reboot?
which wiki page is that?
https://wiki.ubuntu.com/DMA?highlight=%28dma%29
if you are referring to /etc/hdparm.conf, that is just telling bootup to run hdparm, and with what parameters
yeah, a bit annoying
ah! yeah, that makes sense, thanks
and why does publicly information have to be secured? Makes no sense.
maybe it's just an easy solution to protect the password login
but it does seem to be overkill. and, for me anyway, the site seems slow
the public can't edit that wiki? what they need a password for?
no, you need to register. registration is open and free
yeah, apparently you need to create an account and get a password on that wiki to edit, see what you're saying
i would guess you need to enable rockridge or joliet extensions
i think /dev/sg* are scsi devices; i can't remember the details
yeah, I remember something about that too.  I think you're right, but I'm not sure.
